news_header: Exercise improves fat tissue quality in overweight individuals, reducing health risks.
news_text: A recent study indicates that exercise enhances the quality of fat tissue in overweight individuals, which contributes positively to health by improving the ability to store fat. This research, involving Professor Jeffrey Horowitz from the University of Michigan, compared two groups of overweight participants: one group exercised regularly while the other did not. Findings showed that regular exercise led to changes in protein composition, increased blood vessel growth, and reduced inflammation in fat tissue. The study highlights the benefits of exercise for overweight individuals, even if it does not lead to weight loss.
